str2: To die, be dying, be dead. A strengthened form of a simpler primary thano than'-o; to die.

parse: Verb - Aorist Indicative Active - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To go out, come out. From ek and erchomai; to issue.
The, the definite article. Including the feminine he, and the neuter to in all their inflections; the definite article; the.

And, even, also, namely.
The foot. A primary word; a 'foot'.

parse: Verb - Perfect Participle Middle or Passive - Nominative Masculine Singular
str2: To bind, tie, fasten; I impel, compel; I declare to be prohibited and unlawful. A primary verb; to bind.
A kind of girdle made of cords; a bandage, grave clothes. Of uncertain affinity; a swathe, i.e. Winding-sheet.
And, even, also, namely.

parse: Personal / Possessive Pronoun - Genitive Masculine 3rd Person Singular
str2: He, she, it, they, them, same. From the particle au; the reflexive pronoun self, used of the third person, and of the other persons.
From optanomai; properly, sight, i.e. the visage, an external show.

parse: Verb - Pluperfect Indicative Middle or Passive - 3rd Person Singular
str2: To bind (tie) around. Peri and deo; to bind around one, i.e. Enwrap.
A handkerchief, napkin. Of Latin origin; a sudarium, i.e. Towel.

str2: A primary verb; to 'loosen'.

str2: From apo and hiemi; to send forth, in various applications.

To go away, depart, begone, die. From hupo and ago; to lead under, i.e. Withdraw or retire, literally or figuratively.
Of Hebrew origin; Jesus, the name of our Lord and two other Israelites.

str2: (a) I say, speak; I mean, mention, tell, (b) I call, name, especially in the pass., (c) I tell, command.
